fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48736].
  {panel}

# Click . . . Next to Calendar, select *Subscribe*
# Copy the .ics link
# In iCal, *File > New Calendar Subscription...*
# Paste .ics URL.
# Error: {quote}There was an error subscribing to the calendar.

There was an unexpected error with the request on
subscribed calendars (error -1).{quote}

!Screen Shot 2014-11-10 at 16.22.36.jpg|thumbnail!

Error generated in the logs:

{noformat}2014-11-10 14:03:44.369730500 2014-11-10 14:03:44,364 ERROR [TP-Processor26] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Server Error in REST: 500: com.sun.jersey.core.spi.factory.ResponseImpl@7abdb9
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369733500  -- url: /wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/export/subcalendar/private/7c733c4ecf6990abe9e3f8098ccf5735c10e4de2.ics | userName: anonymous
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369733500 javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.lang.NullPointerException
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369734500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$22.write(CalendarResource.java:1856)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369749500 	at com.sun.jersey.core.impl.provider.entity.StreamingOutputProvider.writeTo(StreamingOutputProvider.java:71)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369749500 	at com.sun.jersey.core.impl.provider.entity.StreamingOutputProvider.writeTo(StreamingOutputProvider.java:57)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369750500 	at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse.write(ContainerResponse.java:306)
...
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369991500 Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369992500 	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.PropertyList.getProperty(PropertyList.java:99)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369992500 	at net.fortuna.ical4j.transform.PublishTransformer.transform(PublishTransformer.java:73)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369993500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.util.CalendarExportTransformer.transform(CalendarExportTransformer.java:72)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369995500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultICalendarExporter.getTransformedSubCalendarContent(DefaultICalendarExporter.java:144)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369996500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultICalendarExporter.export(DefaultICalendarExporter.java:64)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369997500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$22.write(CalendarResource.java:1852)
2014-11-10 14:03:44.369999500 	... 232 more{noformat}

h4. Temporary Workaround - Restart Confluence

May be related to TEAMCAL-2527. This does not occur on all instances of Team Calendar, so it could still be part of the timezone issues.
fields.summary: NPE When Subscribing to .ics Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48733].
  {panel}

*Problem*  
User A creates a Calendar UserA (Caputure1.PNG) adds the Jira Issue Dates Event,  Issues are displayed as a one day event.  
User B Adds an Existing Calendar UserA (Capture2.png) Issues are displayed as a two day event.  
*Note:* If UserB adds Jira Issue Dates Event to UserB Calendar (Capture3.png) Issues are displayed as one day event.
{panel:title=How to Reproduce}
# Log in as user 1 in Confluence
# Go to calendars
# Add New Calendar
# Fill in details (Time zone: Europe/Amsterdam +0200)
# Add event under new created calendar
# Event details:
#* Event type: Jira issue dates
#* Display: project (Choose Jira project)
#* Show: all boxes checked
#* No date range selected
# The dates appear correctly (one-day events)
# Log off
# Log in as user 2 in Confluence
# Go to calendars
# *Add Existing Calendar*
# Search for calendars
# Add the calendar made by user 1
# The events appear, but spread over two days
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Existing Calendar renders Jira Event Times (Dates) incorrectly as  two day event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48731].
  {panel}

Step to reproduce the issue:

* go on your calendars
* select the "List" view mode
* click on an event, a balloon window with the details is displayed (containing Edit / Delete link)
* click elsewhere to make the window to dissapears
* click again on the same event, the details are no more displayed
* you need to refresh the page to be abble to see again the details

Identified in TCAL 5.2.18 (with CONF 5.8.5), the issue is also present in TCAL 5.3.4 (with CONF 5.8.13).
The issue occurs both in FF and Chrome (latest versions). And is present either on the "My calendar" screen or within the "Team Calendars" macro
fields.summary: Details of event can't be displayed twice in "List" view mode
ICS files: strange merging of SUMMARY and DESCRIPTION fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48729].
  {panel}

h3. Description
An event will not be deleted when deleting a recurring event for only one instance.

h3. Reproduce
# Add a recurring event
# Click on it from the month overview
!image-2016-04-05-15-39-28-888.png|thumbnail! 
# Click delete and this instance only
 !image-2016-04-05-15-39-58-110.png|thumbnail! 
# The event dissapears (as expected)
# Refresh site
# The recurring event is back again
fields.summary: Can't delete Recurring Event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48728].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a space in Confluence.
# Add a new Calendar, and put the newly created space in "Related Space".
# Proceed to delete the Space from Space Tools.
# Login with a different user in your Confluence instance.
# Add an existing Calendar, and search for the Calendar you just created.  Try adding it.

h4. Actual Results
Nothing happens, and Calendar will not be added. 

h4. Possible Workaround
Creator of  Calendar can edit the Calendar and remove the Space name from "Related Space".
fields.summary: Unable to add existing calendars when actual space from "Related Space" is deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48727].
  {panel}

Hi Folks,

Our Team calendar has stopped working. I have attached a print screen of the Error below. I have also fund the following in the Audit logs:

Failed to enable add-on Team Calendars (com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars)	anonymous	Jun 29 2015 3:13:54 AM
Added license key for Team Calendars (com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars)	anonymous	Jun 29 2015 3:13:43 AM
Added license key for Team Calendars (com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars)	anonymous	Jun 24 2015 1:34:36 AM
Added license key for Team Calendars (com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars)	anonymous	Jun 15 2015 2:23:09 AM

Can you advise a fix asap???

Regards,
Danny.
fields.summary: This add-on couldn't be loaded. It has one or more errors that prevent it from being enabled.
My confluence calendars names all changed automatically. How did this happen?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48722].
  {panel}

The root cause of this problem is cause by space-ia plugin in Confluence. They override the global css.
- This issue seems only affect TC on BTF Confluence (tested with Confluence 5.6.1 and Confluence 5.6.3).  

- OD instances do not affect by this issue 

we have to update TC to deal with fixed height of the dialog.
fields.summary: Create calendar dialog and popular calendar dialog are broken on embedded editor page
Gmail trims the email :(

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48720].
  {panel}

Confluence version: 5.8.15

I am not really sure who to recreate this bug, but I will do my best to describe it here.

Some of the changes made in the calendar online are not changed in the exported to the ics file.
For example, I created a series of entries. Then I realized, that they were off by on day. So I moved them and deleted some of the entries at the start of the series. It worked well at the online calendar, but at the ics which is used in e.g. Thunderbird, some of the removed entries are still in. 
This happens also if other colleges remove entries form series that have been there a while.
fields.summary: Exported ICS file contains wrong entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48718].
  {panel}

Steps:
- In space calendars, create new calendar
- Create new Jira event (1 of 3 jira event type)
=> Actual: My calendars are loaded into space calendar
=> Expected: Space calendars should be loaded

Root cause:
calendarContext and viewingSpaceKey are not sent correctly when adding jira events

Test cases:
- Test with create new jira events (3 types) in space calendar => space calendars should be loaded correctly
- Test with edit jira events (3 types) in space calendar => space calendars should be loaded correctly
- Test with create new jira events (3 types) in my calendar => my calendars should be loaded correctly
- Test with edit jira events (3 types) in my calendar => my calendars should be loaded correctly
fields.summary: Calendars are load incorrectly after creating Jira events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48703].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Monthly repeated event team calendar showing one hour difference between October and November for start time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new team calendar with Europe/Moscow Timezone
 * Change Profile Timezone to moscow. Profile > Settings 
 * Create an event and set it to below configuration

 
{quote}Event Type : Event
 What : Test
 All day event : (untick)
 When : 10-Nov-2016 08:00 to 10-Nov-2016 09:00 
 Repeat: Monthly
 Repeat Every : 1 Month
{quote} * Click ok

 
h3. Expected Results

User should be seeing the same start time set in october in november which is "08:00"
h3. Actual Results

User seeing the start time set on November is "09:00"
fields.summary: 1 hour difference between October and November in Team Calendar
Confluence email "... updated a event" should be "... an event"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48699].
  {panel}

Unable to change the colors on a team calendar when creating custom event types, when a user tries to change the color they get the following error:

 Error(s) occurred.

    Unable to change the color of the calendar. Please authenticate first.

This also occurs for non custom event types.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8.4
# Install Team Calendars 5.2.13
# Create a calendar without a related space.
# Add a 'Travel' event and change colors. 
# Verify color change.
# Upgrade to Team Calendars 5.3.9
# Attempt to change color of 'Travel' event and get error.

h6. Workaround
* Add a related space to the calendar
fields.summary: Unable to change the colors on a team calendar with custom event types

2015-05-11 21:00:54,509 ERROR [Indexer: 1] [confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultEmbeddedSubCalendarsParser] getEmbeddedSubCalendarIds Unable to parse sub-calendars embedded in spacedesc: Mitglieder v.2 (753665)

Precondition
* Create a project TEST and an issue TEST (at 08/Oct/14 11:33 AM)

Steps
# Create a JIRA issue Dates event, select "Issue Created Date" or "Issue Resolved Date"
# Observe this event on Team Calendar

Actual

Expected

fields.summary: JIRA issue shows Created in 2 days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48681].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding an existing calendar, search results (if providing more than 4 calendars that match the search query, thus causing a scrollbar to appear), scroll infinitely.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.161.0
Team Calendar 5.3.11-D20160504T003457

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create at least 4 calendars in Team Calendar that share a similar keyword.
# Now attempt to Add New Calendar > Add Existing Calendar (you can follow the video)
# Click to search, and type the keyword you used, and you'll see the results keep scrolling
 [^Recording #12.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Only 1 of each result should appear

h3. Actual Results
Results go on forever
Additionally, if there are fewer than 4 calendars w/ the shared keyword, they duplicate.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Add existing calendar search results produce duplicated or infinite results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48680].
  {panel}

This has already been documented by another user at: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-2729

However, that issue - and issues linked to it - were marked closed as duplicates (even though none of them were actually resolved).

Team Calendars version 5.1.7 upgrade resulted in our custom date (only) fields being displayed as date/time fields.  The default times were 6:00pm to 6:00pm for a full day event (all of ours are full day events because they originate in date only custom fields.)  This addition of a time was shifting the display of date ranges by a day.

I downgraded to 5.0.5 and the problem went away - but eventually we will want to upgrade.
fields.summary: Custom date field showing as date/time on Team Calendars and shifting the date range bar by a day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48679].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When Team Calendar is not enabled on an instance, users can still see the Calendars link. When trying to create a Calendar the create window does not respond.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# A new instance without Confluence Team Calendar Enabled
# Navigate to a space
# Click on Calendars
!Screen Shot 2015-09-24 at 9.48.36 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Or Click the Create option
!Screen Shot 2015-09-24 at 10.07.06 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Choose Calendar
# Add Calendar
# Add New Calendar

h3. Actual Result
The fields in the popup window will not respond.

h3. Expected Result
User should be notified that the plugin needs to be enabled.

h3. Workaround
Start trial for Team Calendar.
fields.summary: Team Calendar not Responding

SUMMARY:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48647].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After upgrade Team Calendar 5.3 to use Space centric team Calendars:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/30+August+2015+to+5+September+2015#id-30August2015to5September2015-TeamCalendars5.3

given the new space restriction, the auto population will only suggest pages that are in the same space.  It is no longer possible to search for related pages in alternate spaces.

h3. Environment
Team Calendar 5.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add event to Team Calendar
# Start typing in Related Pages Field

h3. Expected Results
All pages user has space permissions to view will auto populate

h3. Actual Results
only pages from the current space are returned

h3.Workaround
Manually add the Full Page URL for the desired related page
fields.summary: Can No longer Search related pages from other spaces

Steps
* Create an OD instance (HAL9K)
* Click on ? icon then click on About Confluence link
* => It shows Confluence information

Actual

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48642].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to My Calendars in Confluence.
# Click Add Calendars, choose Subscribe by URL.
# Enter the details to subscribe to a calendar (make sure it's a raw .ics file), click Subscribe.
# Mouse-over the "..." next to the newly added calendar.

h3. Expected results
The "Edit" link exists at the top of the dropdown, and when you select Restrictions, the "General" link exists at the top of the left-hand panel in the dialog that pops up.

h3. Actual results
The Edit link doesn't exist:

!actions.png!

And in the dialog, the General link doesn't have any text associated with it:

!dialog.png!

h3. Workaround
To get into the dialog in the first place, select "Restrictions". One it opens, you'll see there's a blank space above Event Types that can be selected to get into the "General" section.
fields.summary: "Edit" link for subscribed calendars is invisible
Event Type Icons jump around when selecting
Typo in the notification message relate to reminder options enable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48639].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When choosing the down arrow to the right of *Add Calendar*, it would provide a form to Create a new Calendar instead of an option to pick any of the following (Add Existing Calendar, Import Calendar, Subscribe by URL)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the down arrow to the right of *Add Calendar*
# A form the create a new calendar would appear

h3. Expected Results
* Choosing the down arrow to the right of the *Add Calendar* should provide an option to add other calendar.
*  !Screen Shot 2016-04-11 at 11.18.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Confluence Version:

When updating an event of "JIRA Issue Date" Event-type with a daterange, Created to DueDate, and changing the DueDate by drag&drop I get a permission error. 
A single date event for the same issue and DueDate can be moved with drag&drop.

When updating an event of "JIRA Issue Date" Event-type with a single date using "Edit" in details I get a "No custom event type found with key jira."-error but the issue is updated correctly.

See attached recordings for a step by step.

BR
David Jansson

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48630].
  {panel}

Our Client use Confluence 5.6.5 and JIRA 6.3.12 and last Team Calendar.
They use JIRA issues Event in the Calendar with period of date (Start Date and End Date)

In case that Start Date and End Date are not far away of current date - everything is ok.
But if Start Date is half a year ago, and End date is have a year after current date, then an issue will not be shown in a calendar.
It it right behavior? What does it depend on?
fields.summary: Longterm JIRA issues doesn't shown in Calendar

We are running the current version of TC, 5.2.16.

On https://my.atlassian.com/download/source/teamcalendars, it says "Your license entitles you to the Confluence Team Calendars source for the period of your license."

But there is only source for version 5.2.8(-SNAPSHOT).

Please make available the source for TC 5.2.16 (and the other versions, of course).

(Incidentally, 5.2.16 is marked as "unreleased" in this JIRA instance. Please correct that, too)

Our enterprise has recently moved over to Office 365 and we our users are having difficulty in subscribing to team calendars using the ics URL provided for a team calendar.

We are seeing the error in Office "Couldn't open calendar : The action couldn't be completed. The error code is -1" (See attached).

We've also attempted to export to ical functionality in Team Calendars and then attemped to upload the ics file manually but nothing is recognised by O365.

Can you please advise if there is anything we can do from Confluence side to try and get this working?

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48605].
  {panel}

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() 

began returning extra items the given users had not actually touched. This can inflate and give inaccurate figures which need to be rooted out by hand or filtered with something more like: 

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily posses the item when resolving.
fields.summary: resolvedBy is populating from linked issues

h3. Summary
Can't move pages with Team Calendars macro and Confluence takes very long time to respond after trying to move pages that have Team Calendar macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Add a TC macro.
# Try to move the page

h3. Expected Results
The page will be moved successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The page is not moved and the following message appears:
{quote}
Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Remove the TC macro.
fields.summary: Can't move pages with Team Calendars macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48589].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Event information is not imported whenever you try to import an ICS file from Google Calendars that contains repeat events. If you open the ICS file in a text editor and there are multiple events with the same UID parameter, only 1 event will get imported. All others will be missing and no logs are captured (even in DEBUG) stating this error.

{code}BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150918T150000Z
DTEND:20150918T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150923T164702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:USER@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150906T150000Z
DTEND:20150906T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150925T154702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:ken@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT
{code}

In this example, only the event for 09-06-2015 will get imported and all other events with this UID will not.

h3. Environment
Confluence with Team Calendars version 5.2.18

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendars
# Click on Add Calendar --> Import Calendar
# Upload an iCal file that includes repeat events with the same UID parameter.

h3. Expected Results
All events get imported or a warning comes up stating why this cannot be completed.

h3. Actual Results
Events are missing in Team Calendars.

h3.Workaround
Editing the iCal file in a text editor and changing the UID parameter for those repeat events then saving will result in a successful import after trying again. Example above with unique UID (adding the word TWO before the UID)

{code}BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150918T150000Z
DTEND:20150918T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150923T164702Z
UID:o8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:USER@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20150906T150000Z
DTEND:20150906T163000Z
DTSTAMP:20150925T154702Z
UID:TWOo8hvlu94i7urfls69lm323srlc@google.com
ATTENDEE;X-NUM-GUESTS=0:mailto:ken@avenoso.com
SUMMARY:Busy
END:VEVENT
{code}
fields.summary: Imports/subscriptions from Google Calendar with non-unique UID's missing in Team Calendars

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48572].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When repeating an event in Team Calendars (Confluence) and selecting an End Repeat Date, the event fails to save. 

h3. Environment
{{Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.40.1-0001}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create An Event
# Select Daily, Weekdays, Weekly, Monthly or Yearly for Repeat
# For End repeat, enter a date for On Date
# Click OK

h3. Expected Results
The event saves, creating a repeating an event on the calendar 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the confluence log file:
{noformat}
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411063500 2015-10-12 19:43:13,406 WARN [ajp-bio-127.0.0.101-8009-exec-10] [extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date 2015-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/20151012T190213Z--679111344@testing124.atlassian.net time 08:00
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411065500  -- referer: /wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: sysadmin
2015-10-12 19:43:13.411066500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid format: "2015-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/2015..." is malformed at "15-10-12T01:00:00.000+01:00/2015..."
{noformat}

On the user end, they receive a similar error:
{code}
Invalid date specified. It should look like 12-Oct-2015
{code}

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: End Repeat Functionality Does Not Work When Specifying End Repeat Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48570].
  {panel}

Team Calendar events is not showing in Google Chrome when the timezone for Confluence is set to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd and the user's Windows PC timezone is set to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd as well.

Steps to reproduce
# Set Confluence timezone to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd
# Login with a Windows PC with Google Chrome. Set the timezone to Moscow, St. Petersburg, Volgograd like the screenshot below
!timeZoneTeamCalendarBug.jpg|thumbnail!
# Go to Team Calendar and you will see that all events are not shown 
!afterTimeZoneChange.jpg|thumbnail!
# Change timezone to other timezone in Windows. You will see that all events is now shown.
!beforeTimeZoneChange.jpg|thumbnail!

This is occurring on the latest version of Team Calendar (5.0.5)

*Workaround*
* Change the timezone of the Windows PC that is affected to a different timezone. However, please note that this might trigger other bugs on other applications.
* Alternatively, use a different browser other than Google Chrome. (eg. IE or Firefox)
fields.summary: events is not showing when timezone for Confluence is set to Moscow, St Petersburg, Volgograd

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48569].
  {panel}

Searching for calendars is not currently working on Cloud instances.

When searching, no calendars are found, even when searching for calendars that should be found (not yet added to the current user's calendars and with no restrictions) and a stacktrace appears in the logs. This is illustrated below:
!calendar_not_found.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a calendar with no restrictions
# Remove it from your calendars, without deleting the calendar
#* Alternatively, simply log in as a different user that hasn't added this calendar yet
# Search for this calendar to re-add it

*Expected behavior*
# Calendar is found

*Actual outcome*
# No calendar is found
# Error appears in the logs

The stacktrace is:
{noformat}
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858271500 2015-04-22 16:50:19,851 ERROR [TP-Processor36] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: fields must not contain '*' - got '*'
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858272500  -- referer: https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/search/subcalendars.json | userName: user
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858273500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fields must not contain '*' - got '*'

2015-04-22 11:50:19.858286500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.getUsersSubscribingToSubCalendar(DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.java:197)
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858287500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.getUsersSubscribingToSubCalendar(DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.java:106)
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858291500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.getUsersSubscribingToSubCalendar(DefaultSubCalendarSubscriptionStatisticsAccessor.java:190)
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858292500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource.shouldSubCalendarBeVisibleInSearchResult(CalendarResource.java:2444)
2015-04-22 11:50:19.858293500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource.access$3600(CalendarResource.java:114)

2015-04-22 11:50:19.858295500 	at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25)
{noformat}

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48565].
  {panel}

After upgrade team calendar to 5.2.13 from 2.6.0, team calendar plugin does not work. ( Confluence upgrade to 5.7.3 from 4.3.2)

My calendar Action (dashboard > Calendar)  does not work like below screenshot and error log
!screenshot-1.png!
{noformat}
2015-06-29 10:24:25,731 WARN [catalina-exec-1520] [opensymphony.xwork.util.OgnlValueStack] findValue Caught an exception while evaluating expression 'calendarHtml' against value stack

fields.summary: team calendar plugin does not work after upgrade.
The default logging level for Team Calendars is incorrect
Reminder email doesn't show "turn on remind me" link when users has been mentioned
Add Confluence team calender programmatically
The last edited calendar is loaded after editing other calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48551].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Confluence users that had previous subscribed to a calendar still receive notifications when calendar have new events added or when events in the subscribed calendar are modified even after their 'can use' permission has been revoked from the Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user in Confluence. 
# Assign a group that are allow to use/login to Confluence (eg. confluence-users) to the user
# Make the new user watch a calendar in Team Calendar
# Remove the group membership from the user. (!) The user can no longer use the Confluence.
# # Modified or add a new event into the watched calendar

h3.  Expected Results

Confluence should not send notification to  users who are not permitted to use the Confluence

h3. Actual Results

Confluence process the notification and publish notification to non permitted user.
fields.summary: Not Permitted Users Receive Notification from Team Calendar
